segment.source: What's New in MED-V 2.0
segment.target: What's New in MED-V 2.0

segment.source: What's New in MED-V 2.0
segment.target: What's New in MED-V 2.0

segment.source: What's New in MED-V 2.0
segment.target: What's New in MED-V 2.0

segment.source: Microsoft Enterprise Desktop Virtualization (MED-V) 2.0 has evolved the application compatibility support for Windows 7 and removed functionality that is not required for this scenario.
segment.target: Microsoft Enterprise Desktop Virtualization (MED-V) 2.0 has evolved the application compatibility support for Windows 7 and removed functionality that is not required for this scenario.

segment.source: For example, features such as encryption of the MED-V workspace, the centralized MED-V server, and MED-V workspace trim transfer have been removed.
segment.target: For example, features such as encryption of the MED-V workspace, the centralized MED-V server, and MED-V workspace trim transfer have been removed.

segment.source: Changes in Standard Functionality
segment.target: Changes in Standard Functionality

segment.source: This section discusses the key areas where MED-V 2.0 functionality has changed.
segment.target: This section discusses the key areas where MED-V 2.0 functionality has changed.

segment.source: MED-V Workspace Creation
segment.target: MED-V Workspace Creation

segment.source: The virtual hard disk used for the MED-V workspace is now created in Windows Virtual PC.
segment.target: The virtual hard disk used for the MED-V workspace is now created in Windows Virtual PC.

segment.source: The methods that are used to create the MED-V workspace include installing Windows XP SP3, updating the operating system, and preparing it to be managed through software management infrastructure.
segment.target: The methods that are used to create the MED-V workspace include installing Windows XP SP3, updating the operating system, and preparing it to be managed through software management infrastructure.

segment.source: The offline management and trim transfer functionality were removed, in addition to the proprietary MED-V workspace encryption and compression functionality.
segment.target: The offline management and trim transfer functionality were removed, in addition to the proprietary MED-V workspace encryption and compression functionality.

segment.source: When you create a MED-V workspace, an administrator should prepare and configure appropriate applications and management tools in the image instead of using the virtual machine preparation tool that is provided in MED-V 1.0.
segment.target: When you create a MED-V workspace, an administrator should prepare and configure appropriate applications and management tools in the image instead of using the virtual machine preparation tool that is provided in MED-V 1.0.

segment.source: Running Sysprep on the MED-V image is now required and validated during the packaging of the MED-V workspace.
segment.target: Running Sysprep on the MED-V image is now required and validated during the packaging of the MED-V workspace.

segment.source: The MED-V Workspace Packager provides a graphical user interface (GUI) that guides the administrator through the packaging process.
segment.target: The MED-V Workspace Packager provides a graphical user interface (GUI) that guides the administrator through the packaging process.

segment.source: The console from MED-V 1.0 was removed together with the functionality of managing images, managing MED-V workspace profiles, and the requirement to stage and encrypt MED-V workspaces.
segment.target: The console from MED-V 1.0 was removed together with the functionality of managing images, managing MED-V workspace profiles, and the requirement to stage and encrypt MED-V workspaces.

segment.source: MED-V Workspace Deployment
segment.target: MED-V Workspace Deployment

segment.source: To deploy a MED-V workspace, an administrator is now able to take advantage of their electronic software distribution tools.
segment.target: To deploy a MED-V workspace, an administrator is now able to take advantage of their electronic software distribution tools.

segment.source: The client-pull method available in MED-V 1.0 was removed and the MED-V workspace is now delivered by using methods outside MED-V.
segment.target: The client-pull method available in MED-V 1.0 was removed and the MED-V workspace is now delivered by using methods outside MED-V.

segment.source: Administrators can treat MED-V workspaces as they would any other application package and can schedule deployments and installations of MED-V by using their existing tools and processes.
segment.target: Administrators can treat MED-V workspaces as they would any other application package and can schedule deployments and installations of MED-V by using their existing tools and processes.

segment.source: MED-V installations can be deployed silently and can easily be managed inside an existing software distribution infrastructure.
segment.target: MED-V installations can be deployed silently and can easily be managed inside an existing software distribution infrastructure.

segment.source: MED-V Workspace Management
segment.target: MED-V Workspace Management

segment.source: The MED-V workspace in MED-V 2.0 is based on a Windows Virtual PC virtual hard disk.
segment.target: The MED-V workspace in MED-V 2.0 is based on a Windows Virtual PC virtual hard disk.

segment.source: MED-V has extended the capabilities that Windows Virtual PC provides by improving the seamless experience without requiring encryption or special tools to access the MED-V workspace.
segment.target: MED-V has extended the capabilities that Windows Virtual PC provides by improving the seamless experience without requiring encryption or special tools to access the MED-V workspace.

segment.source: After MED-V is deployed to a workstation, the MED-V workspace can be opened in full-screen mode by using Windows Virtual PC.
segment.target: After MED-V is deployed to a workstation, the MED-V workspace can be opened in full-screen mode by using Windows Virtual PC.

segment.source: This new functionality removed the requirement for policies that set a preference for seamless or full-screen modes and also removed the need to force full-screen for diagnostics and troubleshooting.
segment.target: This new functionality removed the requirement for policies that set a preference for seamless or full-screen modes and also removed the need to force full-screen for diagnostics and troubleshooting.

segment.source: Publishing applications to the MED-V workspace is no longer performed with profiles and by manually entering the path to applications.
segment.target: Publishing applications to the MED-V workspace is no longer performed with profiles and by manually entering the path to applications.

segment.source: Instead, it occurs automatically as applications are installed on the guest.
segment.target: Instead, it occurs automatically as applications are installed on the guest.

segment.source: The central image repository that included versions of the images that were delivered through trim transfer is removed.
segment.target: The central image repository that included versions of the images that were delivered through trim transfer is removed.

segment.source: Instead, MED-V enables administrators to manage the MED-V workspace as they would a physical computer, by letting applications and updates be distributed without the complexity of a dedicated MED-V infrastructure.
segment.target: Instead, MED-V enables administrators to manage the MED-V workspace as they would a physical computer, by letting applications and updates be distributed without the complexity of a dedicated MED-V infrastructure.

segment.source: Changes in MED-V Features
segment.target: Changes in MED-V Features

segment.source: Several key areas of MED-V 2.0 reflect improvements or additions to the following features.
segment.target: Several key areas of MED-V 2.0 reflect improvements or additions to the following features.

segment.source: MED-V Workspace Creation
segment.target: MED-V Workspace Creation

segment.source: MED-V workspaces must be created by using Windows Virtual PC.
segment.target: MED-V workspaces must be created by using Windows Virtual PC.

segment.source: Existing Virtual PC 2007 images must be migrated.
segment.target: Existing Virtual PC 2007 images must be migrated.

segment.source: The virtual machine Prep tool is not included in MED-V 2.0 and administrators should configure, update, and optimize their images according to the MED-V 2.0 Help file.
segment.target: The virtual machine Prep tool is not included in MED-V 2.0 and administrators should configure, update, and optimize their images according to the MED-V 2.0 Help file.

segment.source: Running Sysprep on the MED-V image is a required step and must be performed before packaging.
segment.target: Running Sysprep on the MED-V image is a required step and must be performed before packaging.

segment.source: MED-V Workspace Packaging
segment.target: MED-V Workspace Packaging

segment.source: Windows PowerShell is the foundation of the MED-V Workspace Packager.
segment.target: Windows PowerShell is the foundation of the MED-V Workspace Packager.

segment.source: This functionality replaces some former console abilities and functionality that managed centralized functions of MED-V.
segment.target: This functionality replaces some former console abilities and functionality that managed centralized functions of MED-V.

segment.source: The MED-V Workspace Packager merely packages the virtual hard disk with the appropriate settings and image so that it can be easily deployed by administrators.
segment.target: The MED-V Workspace Packager merely packages the virtual hard disk with the appropriate settings and image so that it can be easily deployed by administrators.

segment.source: Advanced features are provided by using Windows PowerShell.
segment.target: Advanced features are provided by using Windows PowerShell.

segment.source: MED-V Workspace Distribution
segment.target: MED-V Workspace Distribution

segment.source: Dedicated server infrastructure is no longer required for MED-V 2.0 and the client pull method to deploy MED-V workspaces was removed.
segment.target: Dedicated server infrastructure is no longer required for MED-V 2.0 and the client pull method to deploy MED-V workspaces was removed.

segment.source: MED-V workspaces are now deployed using your electronic software distribution infrastructure and can be stored on common shares that are used for other installation packages.
segment.target: MED-V workspaces are now deployed using your electronic software distribution infrastructure and can be stored on common shares that are used for other installation packages.

segment.source: First Time Setup
segment.target: First Time Setup

segment.source: The first time setup process is now integrated with the standard imaging convention of Sysprep.
segment.target: The first time setup process is now integrated with the standard imaging convention of Sysprep.

segment.source: The MED-V workspace first time setup process can dynamically apply settings specified in the MED-V Workspace Packager to the image as it begins Mini-Setup.
segment.target: The MED-V workspace first time setup process can dynamically apply settings specified in the MED-V Workspace Packager to the image as it begins Mini-Setup.

segment.source: The scripting tool in the console was removed and the first time setup process is now based on options that are configured in the MED-V Workspace Packager by the administrator.
segment.target: The scripting tool in the console was removed and the first time setup process is now based on options that are configured in the MED-V Workspace Packager by the administrator.

segment.source: Application Publishing
segment.target: Application Publishing

segment.source: Administrators can install applications on the MED-V image either before packaging, after the MED-V workspace is deployed, or by using a combination of both.
segment.target: Administrators can install applications on the MED-V image either before packaging, after the MED-V workspace is deployed, or by using a combination of both.

segment.source: MED-V no longer examines MED-V workspace policy to publish applications, but instead refers to what is actually installed on the guest.
segment.target: MED-V no longer examines MED-V workspace policy to publish applications, but instead refers to what is actually installed on the guest.

segment.source: As applications are installed on the guest, they are automatically detected and published to the host Start menu and are ready to be started by the end user.
segment.target: As applications are installed on the guest, they are automatically detected and published to the host Start menu and are ready to be started by the end user.

segment.source: URL Redirection
segment.target: URL Redirection

segment.source: MED-V 2.0 provides seamless host-to-guest web address redirection based on the policies configured and managed by the administrator.
segment.target: MED-V 2.0 provides seamless host-to-guest web address redirection based on the policies configured and managed by the administrator.

segment.source: After a URL is redirected to the guest browser, the default experience is to attempt to limit the user to that redirected site.
segment.target: After a URL is redirected to the guest browser, the default experience is to attempt to limit the user to that redirected site.

segment.source: This minimizes the browsing activities that a user can perform that are not intended by the administrator.
segment.target: This minimizes the browsing activities that a user can perform that are not intended by the administrator.

segment.source: Guest-to-host browser redirection was removed.
segment.target: Guest-to-host browser redirection was removed.

segment.source: Troubleshooting
segment.target: Troubleshooting

segment.source: MED-V now takes advantage of standard host-based processes for troubleshooting.
segment.target: MED-V now takes advantage of standard host-based processes for troubleshooting.

segment.source: Because the MED-V workspace is no longer encrypted, it can be opened in full-screen mode within the Windows Virtual PC console, where it can be viewed and worked with as a standard workstation.
segment.target: Because the MED-V workspace is no longer encrypted, it can be opened in full-screen mode within the Windows Virtual PC console, where it can be viewed and worked with as a standard workstation.

segment.source: In addition, the logs are no longer encrypted locally and logged centrally.
segment.target: In addition, the logs are no longer encrypted locally and logged centrally.

segment.source: MED-V now makes extensive use of the local event logs, and the logging level of the output, from informational to debug levels, can be easily configured.
segment.target: MED-V now makes extensive use of the local event logs, and the logging level of the output, from informational to debug levels, can be easily configured.

segment.source: Finally, a troubleshooting toolkit is now provided so administrators and helpdesk personnel can have a graphical, aggregated view of all the troubleshooting options, and they can effortlessly select the activities that most suit their needs.
segment.target: Finally, a troubleshooting toolkit is now provided so administrators and helpdesk personnel can have a graphical, aggregated view of all the troubleshooting options, and they can effortlessly select the activities that most suit their needs.

segment.source: MED-V is no longer run as a system service.
segment.target: MED-V is no longer run as a system service.

segment.source: Instead, it is run as user-owned processes, and it only runs when a user is logged on.
segment.target: Instead, it is run as user-owned processes, and it only runs when a user is logged on.

segment.source: Functionality that was formerly provided by the system-owned service is now provided in the user-side processes.
segment.target: Functionality that was formerly provided by the system-owned service is now provided in the user-side processes.

segment.target: Related topics

segment.target: Deployment of MED-V

segment.target: Operations for MED-V
